Title: Nigeria’s external reserves rise as CBN releases 2024 financial report
Summary: Central Bank of Nigeria releases 2024 financial results . Increase in external reserves from $36.6 billion in 2023 to $38.8 billion in 2024 . According to the CBN, this increase is largely due to the increase in reserves .

Title: Storms: FCT emergency department places search, rescue team on alert
Summary: The Federal Capital Territory Emergency Management Department (FEMD) has placed its search and rescue team on high alert . The acting Director-General (D-G) of FEMD, Mr. Abdulrahman Mohammed, disclosed this on Friday .

Title: Tinubu commissions agric mechanised centre, road projects in Katsina
Summary: Tinubu commissioned the Katsina State Agricultural Mechanisation Centre, where 400 brand new tractors and supporting equipment were assembled . The President also commissioned a 24-kilometre road which was completed within the space of 18 months .

Title: Gunmen kill vulcaniser in Edo community
Summary: Suspected gunmen on Friday killed a vulcaniser on the popular Warrake Road in Auchi, Etsako West Local Government Council Area of Edo State . Auchi is a busy town in Edo North Senatorial District and has become a popular tourist destination .

Title: Tinubu tasks governors on performance
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has called on governors to remain focused on delivering tangible results that improve the lives of their people . He urged them to disregard armchair critics . The President gave the charge during a two-day visit to Katsina .

Title: Three children freed in Spain after three years indoors
Summary: Police arrested a German man and a 48-year-old American woman, believed to be the children’s parents . Police arrested the children's father and mother, 53, in Spain .

Title: Zelensky says won’t play Putin’s ‘games’ with short truce
Summary: Volodymyr Zelensky dismissed a three-day truce ordered by Russian leader Vladimir Putin as theatrics but said Kyiv was ready for a full ceasefire . Russia has so far rejected an unconditional 30-day ceasefire pushed by Kyiv and Washington .

Title: Cardinals hold closed-door meeting ahead of papal election
Summary: Cardinal Jean-Paul Vesco, archbishop of Algiers, said he hoped the conclave would choose a pope to follow in Francis' progressive footsteps .

Title: Sponsored walkout on Tinubu’s wife won’t grant you reprieve, Wike tells Fubara
Summary: Wike counselled the suspended governor to demonstrate honesty by being bold enough to tell President Tinubu what exactly he wanted,  Wike said .

Title: PICTORIAL: Many stranded in Abuja after Air Peace cancels multiple flights
Summary: Dozens of passengers, including expatriates, children, and families, were left stranded overnight at the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport in Abuja after Air Peace abruptly cancelled multiple flights . Passengers were forced to sleep on cold, hard aluminium chairs in the departure hall . Air Peace claims the actions are safety-driven and in

Title: Davido gifts Ghanaian TikToker $5,000 for passionate 'With You' performance
Summary: Davido gifts Ghanaian TikToker $5,000 for passionate 'With You' performance . Video shows #Ananzooficial singing with passion and pitch-perfect delivery, capturing the essence of the original track . Davido responded with the generous monetary reward under the comment section .

Title: JUST IN: Nigerian Army Battles ISWAP Terrorist In Yobe
Summary: Operatives of the Nigerian Army under HADIN KAI are locked in a fierce gunfight with fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province . The details of the battle were made known via the agency’s X (formerly Twitter) handle on Saturday .

Title: Cybercriminals can drain bank accounts with just ATM card details, Delta police warn
Summary: Delta State Police have warned Nigerians to exercise extreme caution in handling their ATM cards . Cybercriminals are now using just the details on the cards to empty victims’ bank accounts . This warning comes amid a surge in card-related fraud, as cybercriminals become more sophisticated .

Title: Naira depreciates against dollar at official market
Summary: The naira depreciated on Friday at the official market, trading at N1,602.18 to the dollar . Data from the Central Bank of Nigeria website showed that the Naira lost N5.49 . The local currency, which closed the current week on a negative note, had also opened the trading week with
